# Run these commands in your WSL terminal to resolve the rebase conflicts:

# 1. Remove all backup/temporary files (rename/delete conflicts)
git rm js/arrow_functions.js
git rm js/paint.js.backup
git rm js/paint.js.bak
git rm js/paint.js.fixed
git rm js/paint.js.new
git rm js/paint_backup_corrupted.js
git rm js/paint_final.js
git rm js/paint_refactored.js
git rm js/paint_temp.js

# 2. Accept incoming version of public/js/paint.js (modify/delete conflict)
git add public/js/paint.js

# 3. Remove node_modules lock file (auto-generated)
git rm node_modules/.package-lock.json

# 4. Check what files still have conflicts
git status

# 5. View conflicts in each file (you'll need to manually resolve these):
#    - app.js
#    - css/styles.css
#    - js/project-manager.js
#    - package.json
#    - package-lock.json

# To see conflicts in a file:
# git diff app.js

# After manually resolving conflicts in app.js, css/styles.css, js/project-manager.js, package.json:
git add app.js css/styles.css js/project-manager.js package.json

# Regenerate package-lock.json
npm install

# Add the regenerated lock file
git add package-lock.json

# Continue the rebase
git rebase --continue
